intro: Medinilla quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-sided medinilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular stems. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Medinilla quadrangularis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in humid environments.
